articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Tom Perry, Emily Rose
articles.description: A fresh wave of air raids hit Beirut's southern suburbs in the early hours of Saturday as Israel stepped up attacks on Hezbollah, after a massive strike on the Iran-backed movement's command centre that apparently targeted leader Hassan Nasrallah.
articles.title: Israeli airstrikes rock Beirut, Hezbollah command centre hit

articles.author: Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Armed men fired shots in the air and shut down shops in parts of Beirut and Hezbollah supporters said they were in a state of shock and disbelief on Saturday after the death of the Lebanese armed group's leader, Hassan Nasrallah.
articles.title: Shots in the air, wails and disbelief in Beirut after Hezbollah head killed

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi sought to burnish his country's credentials as a global peacemaker at the United Nations General Assembly on Saturday, calling for a cessation of fighting in the Middle East and touting Beijing's diplomatic efforts on Russia's war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Wang touts China's role as peacemaker, calls for Mideast ceasefire

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: Switzerland's foreign affairs ministry on Saturday voiced support for a Chinese-led peace plan to end the Ukraine war, saying its view on such efforts had significantly changed.
articles.title: Switzerland praises China-Brazil peace plan for Ukraine

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Abdelhadi Ramahi
articles.description: When Israel began pounding the southern Beirut suburb of Dahiyeh in airstrikes that killed Lebanon's Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah, the blasts were so powerful that a pregnant woman feared her baby could not withstand the force.
articles.title: Residents of Beirut suburbs traumatised by Israeli strikes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Recognized as a skilled orator, his speeches were followed by friend and foe alike.
articles.title: Nasrallah led Hezbollah to become regional force

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two consecutive Russian attacks on a medical centre in Sumy in northeastern Ukraine on Saturday morning killed six people, Ukraine's interior minister said.
articles.title: Russian attacks on medical centre kill 6 people in Ukraine's Sumy, minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Poland's 2025 draft budget will set aside 3.2 billion zlotys ($835.88 million) as a reserve for dealing with natural disasters, the finance minister said on Saturday, after devastating floods wreaked havoc in the country.
articles.title: After floods, Poland to boost natural disaster reserve in 2025 budget

articles.author: Gopal Sharma
articles.description: Incessant rains in Nepal have unleashed floods and landslides that killed at least 10 people with seven missing during the last 24 hours, while disrupting transport, officials said on Saturday.
articles.title: Nepal rains bring floods, landslides that kill 10, with seven missing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Japan's incoming prime minister, Shigeru Ishiba, will likely keep Yoshimasa Hayashi as chief cabinet secretary when he forms his cabinet, the Asahi newspaper reported on Saturday.
articles.title: Japan's Ishiba likely to keep Hayashi as chief cabinet secretary in cabinet, Asahi reports
